title: UBS Takes Restructuring Charge as Profits Fall
text:
UBS Group AG said it would weather tougher banking conditions by tightening up the focus of its investment bank and charging large clients for deposits, as it posted a fall in third-quarter profit.

The Swiss bank, one of the world’s largest wealth managers for the rich, said Tuesday it would take a $100 million restructuring charge to carry out organizational changes to its investment bank. Shedding jobs will save around $90 million a year, Chief Executive Sergio Ermotti said. He didn’t say how many roles are being cut.
